reasoning: To understand how to add filterable elements to an issue, I first need to open an issue to inspect its details and available options. I will click on 'DAR-6 New issue title' to open it.
To add filterable elements, I need to look at the right sidebar for options like 'Add label' and 'Add to project'. I will start by clicking 'Add label'.
I have clicked on 'Add label' and now I see a list of labels. To add multiple filterable elements, I need to select the labels one by one. I will start by clicking on 'Bug'.

The goal is to add multiple filterable elements. I have already added one label ('Bug') and one cycle ('Cycle 1'). To add another filterable element, I will click 'Add label' again to add another label, or 'Add to project' to add a project. I will choose to add another label by clicking the 'Add label' button.
I need to add multiple labels to the issue. I have already added 'Bug'. Now I will add 'Feature' by clicking on it.
I have successfully added two labels, 'Bug' and 'Feature', which are multiple filterable elements to the issue. This answers the 'how-to' question posed by the user.
